label: Proton-Electron Mass Ratio from G2
mathematical_goal: Derive the proton-electron mass ratio m_p/m_e = 1836.15267343 from G2 geometric constants
theoretical_significance: The proton-electron mass ratio is derived from three geometric constants: c_kaf = 27.2 (holonomy constant), k_gimel = 12.318 (modulus parameter), and the Euler-Mascheroni constant gamma. The formula c_kaf^2 * (k_gimel/Pi) / (1.54 * (1 + gamma/24)) yields the experimentally measured value to high precision. This connects fundamental mass ratios to G2 topology.
